thread.title: H.S. girls soccer report: Player of the year watch for Oct. 14
thread.title_full: H.S. girls soccer report: Player of the year watch for Oct. 14

title: H.S. girls soccer report: Player of the year watch for Oct. 14
text:
Buy this photo RECORD FILE PHOTO Sophia Gulati was at her best Sunday in IHA’s 3-2 Bergen County tournament win over Fair Lawn, striking for a pair of goals to keep the team undefeated (9-0) against New Jersey teams this season. 
Eva Hurm, Northern Highlands, senior, M/F 
One of the most exciting players in North Jersey when she’s on the run, Hurm has scored eight goals — including two in a 4-0 win over nationally ranked Montclair — and added seven assists. 
Sophia Gulati, IHA, senior, M 
The Blue Eagles’ facilitating playmaker was at her best Sunday in IHA’s 3-2 BCT win over Fair Lawn, striking for a pair of goals to keep the team undefeated (9-0) against New Jersey teams this season. 
Abby Adams, Ramapo, senior, D 
Continues serving as the centerpiece on one of the state’s top defenses, anchoring a unit that has not allowed a goal in nearly a month (Sept. 16) and posted eight straight shutouts (and 10 overall) since a 2-2 start. 
Kelly Walsh, NV/Old Tappan, senior, M 
The center-midfielder greatly impacted NV/OT’s upset 1-0 win over Ramsey in the BCT round of 16 Sunday, assisting on the game-winner. She has a team-best eight goals and seven assists. 
Amanda Fulcher, Lyndhurst, junior, M 
Fulcher is tied for the team lead in goals (16, with Mia Luna) and assists (11, with Giulia Pezzolla).. In one of biggest wins of season against New Milford, Fulcher scored twice and assisted on three in 6-1 win. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
